private_information: I can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks: A, E, I
I can only move blocks that are currently on the top of a stack
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another block
vowel_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks: B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K
I can only move blocks that are currently on the top of a stack
I can move one block at a time and place it either on the table or on top of another block
consonant_agent.goal: Rearrange the blocks so that A is on B, B is on C, C is on D, D is on E, E is on F, F is on G, G is on H, H is on I, I is on J, J is on K, and K is on the table.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their observations to produce a single PDDL domain and problem
I must respect each agent's manipulation constraints (vowels vs consonants, top-only, single-block moves)
orchestrator.goal: Produce a PDDL domain and problem (FastDownward compatible) that encodes the initial configuration, the target configuration, and distinct actions for the vowel and consonant agents so the task can be solved by a planner.

public_information: There are 11 uniquely labelled blocks: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H, I, J, K.
Blocks can only be moved if they are on the top of a stack.
Agents can move only one block at a time and can place a block either on the table or on another block.
One agent can manipulate only vowel-labeled blocks (A, E, I). The other agent can manipulate only consonant-labeled blocks (B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K).
Initial stacks on the table are as follows: Stack1 bottom E -> F -> G -> K -> J -> D top, Stack2 bottom I -> H -> C -> B -> A top.

Goal: form a single stack with K on the table and, from bottom to top, K, J, I, H, G, F, E, D, C, B, A, i.e., A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, and K on the table.

inspect.system_prompt: You are vowel_agent. Provide an observation of the current world state limited to what you can see and act upon given the public information and your private information. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on which blocks you (the vowel agent) are allowed to move and which of those are currently on top of stacks. Also list possible single-block moves you could execute immediately given the top-of-stack constraint.
inspect.prompt: Your name is vowel_agent. Use the public information {environment->public_information} together with your private knowledge {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Describe concisely: (1) which vowel blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore available to you, (2) for each available block, what legal single-block moves you could perform now (place on table or on which other top blocks), and (3) any uncertainties or information you lack. Output in plain text; do not emit PDDL.

inspect.system_prompt: You are consonant_agent. Provide an observation of the current world state limited to what you can see and act upon given the public information and your private information. Do not produce PDDL. Focus on which blocks you (the consonant agent) are allowed to move and which of those are currently on top of stacks. Also list possible single-block moves you could execute immediately given the top-of-stack constraint.
inspect.prompt: Your name is consonant_agent. Use the public information {environment->public_information} together with your private knowledge {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Describe concisely: (1) which consonant blocks are currently at the top of a stack and therefore available to you, (2) for each available block, what legal single-block moves you could perform now (place on table or on which other top blocks), and (3) any uncertainties or information you lack. Output in plain text; do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent PDDL modeling targeting the FastDownward planner. Using the observations provided by the agents, produce a complete PDDL domain and PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags. The domain must be STRIPS-compatible and should include distinct actions for the vowel agent and the consonant agent, respecting that vowel_agent can move only vowels and consonant_agent only consonants, and that both can move only top blocks and one block at a time. Define appropriate types and predicates (for example: block, ontable, on, clear, handempty, holding) and agent-specific action names (for example pick-vowel, put-vowel, pick-consonant, put-consonant) to keep actions distinct. Ensure the problem encodes the exact initial stacks and the goal stack. Aim for compatibility with FastDownward.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the observations {obs_vowel} and {obs_consonant} with the public information {environment->public_information} and the agents' constraints {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} and {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that when given to FastDownward can be used to compute a plan that achieves the global goal {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Enclose the domain in <domain></domain> and the problem in <problem></problem>. Keep the agents' actions distinct and explicitly reflect which agent may perform which actions.
